alert.note: Alert for Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:59AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sussex, Warren, east central Monroe and northeastern Northampton Counties through 730 AM EDT... At 659 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hope, or 17 miles northeast of Easton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Hopatcong, East Stroudsburg, Blairstown, Belvidere, Oxford, Hope, Andover, Stormville, Lake Mohawk, Werry Lake, Greendell, Millbrook, Delaware Water Gap, Crandon Lakes, Great Meadows-Vienna, Flatbrookville, Allamuchy-Panther Valley, Five Points and Columbia. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 309 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
